Description: Rectangular double-toothed comb made of wood. Closely-set teeth on one long side and widely-spaced teeth on other. Comb painted red on outer edges and green at each corner bordering teeth of comb. Central panel is decorated with interlinked ovals formed by black dots of paint (possibly representing the eye ?) with large central red dots inside and is bordered on each long side by series of red dots arranged within parallel black lines.
Curator's comments: Found un-numbered; given 1979 Af1 number in 1992; acquisition details uncertain. Attached Church Missionary Society label reads 'Ornamental wooden comb. Egypt'.
